questions.question: What does biodegradable plastic mean?
questions.answer1: Microorganisms can break the plastic down, even if takes a long time.
questions.answer2: The colour of the plastic is green.
questions.answer3: A plastic breaks down into microplastics.

questions.question: If plastic packaging says compostable, what does this mean?
questions.answer1: It can break down in an industrial composting plant.
questions.answer2: You can throw it in the rubbish bin and it will decompose.
questions.answer3: It will decompose in a general garden compost.

questions.question: What does renewable mean?
questions.answer1: It means that the amount of something can be restored in less than a human lifetime.
questions.answer2: It means something is infinite or that we can use it forever.
questions.answer3: It means that something will be of green colour.

questions.question: What is a plastic?
questions.answer1: A long molecule made from carbon and hydrogen chains.
questions.answer3: A material only used for making shopping bags.

questions.question: Why are so many things made of plastic?
questions.answer1: Because it is a cheap, lightweight, durable material.
questions.answer2: Because it is a cheap, heavy, durable material.
questions.answer3: Because it is an expensive, heavy, durable material.

questions.question: What is a bioplastic?
questions.answer1: A plastic made from renewable biomass sources.
questions.answer2: A plastic made from biological organisms.
questions.answer3: A plastic made from non-renewable biomass sources.

questions.question: Are all biodegradable plastics renewable?
Are all renewable plastics biodegradable?
Can biodegradable plastics be made from oil?
What are plastics made of?
What could plastics be made from?
questions.answer1: A range of materials including the others listed!
questions.answer2: Pine needles, oranges and lemon peel.

questions.question: What’s the difference between biodegradable and renewable?
questions.answer1: Renewable plastics are made from sustainable resources. Biodegradable plastics are able to degrade into harmless molecules under the right conditions.
questions.answer2: There is no difference, they are the same.
questions.answer3: Renewable plastics are made from recycled plastic and biodegradable plastic breaks down until it is very small (micro-sized) plastic.

questions.question: In what year do scientists think the plastics in the ocean will weigh more than the fish?
PLA is a renewable plastic, but how can it be recycled?
What is PLA made from?
questions.answer1: Either Corn Starch or Sugar Cane.

questions.question: What is currently the most common source of plastic?
Plastic bottles are made from a non renewable plastic PET, but how can it be recycled?
questions.answer1: It can be recycled in a plastics recycling bin.
questions.answer2: It can only be recycled in an industrial composter.

questions.question: Which of these plastics is both biodegradable and renewable?
What is the lifetime of traditional plastic in the environment?
questions.answer1: Hundred of years, but it depends on the type of plastic and where it is.

questions.question: Why is polyglycolic acid (PGA) biodegradable but not renewable?
questions.answer1: It is a biodegradable plastic as it is able to degrade into harmless molecules under the right conditions. It is not renewable as it is made from oil.
questions.answer2: It is not renewable as it is made from recycled plastic.
questions.answer3: It is not renewable as it will remain in the natural environment for thousands of years.
